content.title: Mahila Adhikarita Yojana under NSKFDC- Haryana
content.department: Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC)
content.beneficiary: Women Safai Karamchari and their dependent daughters
content.details: The scheme 'Mahila Adhikarita Yojana under NSKFDC' is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC). The HSFDC is a Company registered under the Companies Act, 1956 on 02.01.1971. It is a wholly Government-owned Corporation with a 51% share of the State Government and a 49% share of the Government of India. Under this scheme, the loan is provided to woman Safai Karamchari and their dependent daughters for projects with a maximum project cost of up to ₹2,00,000/- for small and petty trade/businesses, and various other income-generating activities such as beauty parlors, boutiques, cosmetic shops, bangle shop, etc.
benefits: The Corporation provides loans of up to ₹2,00,000/- per beneficiary/unit for small and petty trade/business and various income-generating activities.
Margin money @ 10% of the project cost.
Subsidy @ 50% of the total project cost (Maximum subsidy amount is ₹10,000/-).
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant should be a female.
The applicant's age should be between 18 and 55 years.
The applicant should be either a woman Safai Karamchari or a dependent daughter of Safai Karamchari.
documents_required: Safai Karamchari or dependent of Safai Karamchari Certificate issued by the competent authority

faqs.question: Who implements the Mahila Adhikarita Yojana?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC).

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount under the Mahila Adhikarita Yojana?
faqs.answer: The maximum loan amount provided under this scheme is ₹2,00,000 per beneficiary/unit.

faqs.question: What types of activities can the loan be used for?
faqs.answer: The loan can be used for small and petty trade/business and various income-generating activities such as beauty parlors, boutiques, cosmetic shops, bangle shops, etc.

faqs.question: Is there any subsidy provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, a subsidy at 50% of the total project cost is provided, with a maximum subsidy amount of ₹10,000/-.

faqs.question: What defines a permanent Safai Karamchari?
faqs.answer: A permanent Safai Karamchari is a person engaged in or employed for any sanitation work, including his/her dependents.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the loan?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/ or visit the official website of HSFDC at http://hsfdc.org.in/.
